questions.explanation:
"Moonlight Serenade".

questions.text: Johnny Messher led a band during the big band era. Which of the following instruments did he not play?
questions.explanation:
Trumpet.

	Johnny was a Juilliard School of Music graduate. His theme song was "Can't We Be Friends". At one time his band played a New Years engagement at New York City's Hotel McAlpin.

questions.text: What was the name of Glenn Miller's younger brother?
questions.explanation:
Herb.

	His younger brother led the Herb Miller Orchestra. He played the trumpet and his engagements were mostly hotels and ballrooms.

questions.text: Where did Vaughn Monroe start his career?
questions.explanation:
Boston.

	He started as a trumpet player and then progressed to a singing bandleader. Because of his distinctive voice he was often referred to as "The voice with hairs on his chest", "Old leather tonsils", and "voice with muscles".

questions.text: At age six, Mitch Miller learned to play the piano. What other instrument did he master?
questions.explanation:
Oboe.

	In 1912 he played oboe with symphony orchestras in the Rochester, New York area. In 1932 he joined CBS radio and was a soloist with the CBS Symphony for 11 years.

questions.text: Which is not a big band name?
questions.correct: Herb Masters and His Royal Marshalls
questions.explanation:
Herb Masters and His Royal Marshalls.

	It was Herb Marsh and His Royal Marshalls. Joe "Wingy" Manone's Orchestra's theme song was "Isle Of Capri". Marty Marsala, along with being a band leader, also played drums and trumpet. Muzzy Marcellini played the violin and guitar along with doing vocals.

questions.text: In the fifties, who was the main vocalist with the Freddie Martin Orchestra?
questions.explanation:
Merv Griffin.

	Clark and Wade sang with the band in the thirties, but Feldcamph was his number one vocalist. Merv started in the fifties.

questions.text: What famous singer sang with the Chico Marx Orchestra?
questions.explanation:
Mel Torme.

	Chico had a short-lived orchestra but he was a superb musician playing the piano. Nicknamed the "Velvet Fog", Mel got his start with Chico.

questions.text: Richard Maltby's Orchestra recorded for RCA "X" and VIC Budget labels, later switching over to Columbia Records. Before he formed his band, which of these did he not arrange for?
questions.explanation:
Guy Lombardo.

	His early start was arranging for Goodman and Whiteman before he formed his band. He later gave up his band and started arranging for Lawrence Welk.
